project

Class Agent

  • java.lang.Object
    • project.Entity
      • project.Agent
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Closest, Hamming, RandomStrat

    public abstract class Agent
extends Entity
    Child class of Entity and parent Class of all three types of Agents. This is an abstract class as only it's child classes are instantiated. This class has all the variables specific to all the agents such has their memory and some agent related methods.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected int FOV
      FOV stands for field of view which is the distance in units that the agent can see.
      protected java.util.ArrayList<InanimateObject> memory
      Memory that stores the InanimateObjects that the agent has "captured".
      protected java.util.ArrayList<InanimateObject> nextPossibleObjects
      ArrayList that is refreshed every movement that holds the InanimateObjects in the field of view of the agent.
      protected java.util.ArrayList<Coordinates> stepSequence
      ArrayList that saves all the positions of the Agent.

      • Fields inherited from class project.Entity

        colour, coords, id, shape

      • printArrayListInanimateObjects

        public void printArrayListInanimateObjects(java.util.ArrayList<InanimateObject> array)
        Debug function that prints an ArrayList of inanimate objects with their attributes.
        Parameters:
        array - Arraylist that the method iterates through.

      • printCoordinates

        public void printCoordinates(java.util.ArrayList<Coordinates> array)
        Method that receives an ArrayList of coordinates and prints them in tuple format.
        Parameters:
        array - ArrayList of coordinates that the method will iterate through.

      • setNextPossibleObjects

        protected int setNextPossibleObjects(java.util.ArrayList<InanimateObject> allObjects)
        Method that iterates through all InanimateObjects in the Environment and evaluates the distance between them and the agent. If said distance is smaller than the agents FOV the object is added to the next possible objects ArrayList.
        Parameters:
        allObjects - ArrayList of all objects in the Environment.
        Returns:
        The method returns -1 in case of failure 1 in case of success

      • resetNextPossibleObjects

        protected void resetNextPossibleObjects()
        Method that clears the nextPossibleObjects ArrayList.

      • inMemory

        protected int inMemory(InanimateObject toAdd)
        Method that checks if an InanimateObject is in the agent's memory.
        Parameters:
        toAdd - InanimateObject that we will check.
        Returns:
        The method returns -1 if the object isn't in the memory and 1 if it is.

      • moveTo

        protected void moveTo(Coordinates nextCoords)
        Method to move the agent to new coordinates.
        Parameters:
        nextCoords - Agent's next coordinates.

      • addToMemory

        protected void addToMemory(InanimateObject toAdd)
        Method that adds a new InanimateObject to the Agent's memory. If the Object is already present in it's memory it doesn't.
        Parameters:
        toAdd - InanimateObject that we will add to memory,

      • getNextObject

        protected abstract InanimateObject getNextObject(java.util.ArrayList<InanimateObject> nextPossibleObjects)
        Abstract declaration of method that returns the next InanimateObject to which the agent is going to move. This method is abstract because it will be implemented by all the child classes of Agent.
        Parameters:
        nextPossibleObjects - ArrayList that contains all next possible objects from which the agent will choose one depending on it's policy.
        Returns:
        The method returns the next InanimateObject to where the agent is going to move.

      • addToStepSequence

        protected void addToStepSequence()
        Method that adds current location to the ArrayList that records the agent's movements. As ArrayLists work with reference to objects and the agent's coordinates are constantly changing we must create a new object Coordinates with the values in order to store them properly.

      • compareArrayListsSize

        protected int compareArrayListsSize(java.util.ArrayList<InanimateObject> allObjects,
                        java.util.ArrayList<InanimateObject> memory)
        Method that compares the size of two ArrayLists.
        Parameters:
        allObjects - First ArrayList that is going to be compared. It has all the InanimateObjects in the Environment.
        memory - Second ArrayList that is going to be compared. It contains the memory of the agent.
        Returns:
        The method returns 1 if both ArrayLists have the same size or -1 if the sizes are different.

      • calcDistanceTravalled

        protected int calcDistanceTravalled(java.util.ArrayList<Coordinates> stepSequence)
        Method that is called in the end of each Agent's run that iterates through it's step sequence and calculate the total distance travelled by the Agent.
        Parameters:
        stepSequence - Sequence of the Agent's Coordinates.
        Returns:
        The method returns the total amount of distance travelled by the agent.

      • routine

        public void routine(java.util.ArrayList<InanimateObject> allObjects)
             throws java.io.IOException
        Main method that invokes other methods to perform the agent's routine. This method also writes to a log file all the information of the agent in each iteration (coordinates, perception and memory); In the final iteration it writes the final statistics to the log file.
        Parameters:
        allObjects - All Inanimate Objects in the environment.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
